name: ActivityDefinition
title: ActivityDefinition
publisher: Health Level Seven International (Clinical Decision Support)
description: This resource allows for the definition of some activity to be performed, independent of a particular patient, practitioner, or other performance context.

elements.name: ActivityDefinition
elements.description: This resource allows for the definition of some activity to be performed, independent of a particular patient, practitioner, or other performance context.

elements.name: url
elements.description: An absolute URI that is used to identify this activity definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance; also called its canonical identifier.

elements.name: identifier
elements.description: A formal identifier that is used to identify this activity definition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.

elements.name: version
elements.description: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the activity definition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance.

elements.name: name
elements.description: A natural language name identifying the activity definition.

elements.name: title
elements.description: A short, descriptive, user-friendly title for the activity definition.

elements.name: subtitle
elements.description: An explanatory or alternate title for the activity definition giving additional information about its content.

elements.name: status
elements.description: The status of this activity definition. Enables tracking the life-cycle of the content.

elements.name: experimental
elements.description: A Boolean value to indicate that this activity definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing) and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.

elements.name: subjectCodeableConcept
elements.description: A code or group definition that describes the intended subject of the activity being defined.

elements.name: subjectReference
elements.description: A reference to a Group that describes the intended subject of the activity being defined.

elements.name: date
elements.description: The date (and optionally time) when the activity definition was published.

elements.name: publisher
elements.description: The name of the organization or individual that published the activity definition.

elements.name: contact
elements.description: Contact details to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

elements.name: description
elements.description: A free text natural language description of the activity definition from a consumer's perspective.

elements.name: useContext
elements.description: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed.

elements.name: jurisdiction
elements.description: A legal or geographic region in which the activity definition is intended to be used.

elements.name: purpose
elements.description: Explanation of why this activity definition is needed and why it has been designed as it has.

elements.name: usage
elements.description: A detailed description of how the activity definition is used from a clinical perspective.

elements.name: copyright
elements.description: A copyright statement relating to the activity definition and/or its contents.

elements.name: approvalDate
elements.description: The date on which the resource content was approved by the publisher.

elements.name: lastReviewDate
elements.description: The date on which the resource content was last reviewed.

elements.name: effectivePeriod
elements.description: The period during which the activity definition content was or is planned to be in active use.

elements.name: topic
elements.description: Descriptive topics related to the content of the activity.

elements.name: author
elements.description: An individiual or organization primarily involved in the creation and maintenance of the content.

elements.name: editor
elements.description: An individual or organization primarily responsible for internal coherence of the content.

elements.name: reviewer
elements.description: An individual or organization primarily responsible for review of some aspect of the content.

elements.name: endorser
elements.description: An individual or organization responsible for officially endorsing the content for use in some setting.

elements.name: relatedArtifact
elements.description: Related artifacts such as additional documentation, justification, or bibliographic references.

elements.name: library
elements.description: A reference to a Library resource containing any formal logic used by the activity definition.

elements.name: kind
elements.description: A description of the kind of resource the activity definition is representing.

elements.name: profile
elements.description: A profile to which the target of the activity definition is expected to conform.

elements.name: code
elements.description: Detailed description of the type of activity; e.g. What lab test, what procedure, what kind of encounter.

elements.name: intent
elements.description: Indicates the level of authority/intentionality associated with the activity and where the request should fit into the workflow chain.

elements.name: priority
elements.description: Indicates how quickly the activity should be addressed with respect to other requests.

elements.name: doNotPerform
elements.description: Set this to true if the definition is to indicate that a particular activity should NOT be performed.

elements.name: timingTiming
elements.description: The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.

elements.name: timingDateTime
elements.description: The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.

elements.name: timingAge
elements.description: The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.

elements.name: timingPeriod
elements.description: The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.

elements.name: timingRange
elements.description: The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.

elements.name: timingDuration
elements.description: The period, timing or frequency upon which the described activity is to occur.

elements.name: location
elements.description: Identifies the facility where the activity will occur; e.g. home, hospital, specific clinic, etc.

elements.name: participant
elements.description: Indicates who should participate in performing the action described.

elements.name: productReference
elements.description: Identifies the food, drug or other product being consumed or supplied in the activity.

elements.name: productCodeableConcept
elements.description: Identifies the food, drug or other product being consumed or supplied in the activity.

elements.name: quantity
elements.description: Identifies the quantity expected to be consumed at once (per dose, per meal, etc.).

elements.name: dosage
elements.description: Provides detailed dosage instructions in the same way that they are described for MedicationRequest resources.

elements.name: bodySite
elements.description: Indicates the sites on the subject's body where the procedure should be performed (I.e. the target sites).

elements.name: specimenRequirement
elements.description: Defines specimen requirements for the action to be performed, such as required specimens for a lab test.

elements.name: observationRequirement
elements.description: Defines observation requirements for the action to be performed, such as body weight or surface area.

elements.name: observationResultRequirement
elements.description: Defines the observations that are expected to be produced by the action.

elements.name: transform
elements.description: A reference to a StructureMap resource that defines a transform that can be executed to produce the intent resource using the ActivityDefinition instance as the input.

elements.name: dynamicValue
elements.description: Dynamic values that will be evaluated to produce values for elements of the resulting resource.
